intro: Pycnobotrya nitida, commonly known as the narrow-leafed hakea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Proteaceae. It is native to South Africa, specifically the Western Cape region, where it grows in sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its narrow, needle-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It is often found in open, sunny habitats such as fynbos vegetation. Pycnobotrya nitida is adapted to dry conditions and is an important component of the local flora.
